Arrays are ordered. The order can be changed using various sorting functions. See the array functions section for more information. The count() function can be used to count the number of items in an array.

trans-unit.source: Arrow Functions
Arrow functions became available.
Arrow functions have the basic form fn (argument_list) => expr.
Arrow functions support the same features as anonymous functions, except that using variables from the parent scope is always automatic.

Arrow functions use by-value variable binding. This is roughly equivalent to performing a use($x) for every variable $x used inside the arrow function. A by-value binding means that it is not possible to modify any values from the outer scope. Anonymous functions can be used instead for by-ref bindings.
Arrow functions were introduced in PHP 7.4 as a more concise syntax for anonymous functions.

As mysqli_fetch_all() returns all the rows as an array in a single step, it may consume more memory than some similar functions such as mysqli_fetch_array(), which only returns one row at a time from the result set. Further, if you need to iterate over the result set, you will need a looping construct that will further impact performance. For these reasons mysqli_fetch_all() should only be used in those situations where the fetched result set will be sent to another layer for processing.
trans-unit.target: Como mysqli_fetch_all () devuelve todas las filas como una matriz en un solo paso, puede consumir más memoria que algunas funciones similares como mysqli_fetch_array () , que solo devuelve una fila a la vez del conjunto de resultados. Además, si necesita iterar sobre el conjunto de resultados, necesitará una construcción de bucle que tendrá un mayor impacto en el rendimiento. Por estas razones, mysqli_fetch_all () solo debe usarse en aquellas situaciones en las que el conjunto de resultados obtenido se enviará a otra capa para su procesamiento.

As described in the section about expressions, expression is evaluated to its Boolean value. If expression evaluates to TRUE, PHP will execute statement, and if it evaluates to FALSE - it'll ignore it. More information about what values evaluate to FALSE can be found in the 'Converting to boolean' section.
trans-unit.target: Como se describe en la sección sobre expresiones , la expresión se evalúa según su valor booleano. Si la expresión se evalúa como TRUE , PHP ejecutará la declaración, y si se evalúa como FALSE , la ignorará. Puede encontrar más información sobre qué valores se evalúan como FALSE en la sección 'Conversión a booleano' .

If expression evaluates to true, PHP will execute statement, and if it evaluates to false - it'll ignore it. More information about what values evaluate to false can be found in the 'Converting to boolean' section.

trans-unit.source: As in C or Perl, PHP requires instructions to be terminated with a semicolon at the end of each statement. The closing tag of a block of PHP code automatically implies a semicolon; you do not need to have a semicolon terminating the last line of a PHP block. The closing tag for the block will include the immediately trailing newline if one is present.
trans-unit.target: Como en C o Perl,PHP requiere que las instrucciones terminen con un punto y coma al final de cada declaración.La etiqueta de cierre de un bloque de código PHP implica automáticamente un punto y coma;no es necesario que un punto y coma termine la última línea de un bloque PHP.La etiqueta de cierre del bloque incluirá la nueva línea inmediatamente posterior si hay una presente.

trans-unit.source: As in Perl, you can access a value from the array inside double quotes. However, with PHP you'll need to enclose your array between curly braces.
trans-unit.target: Como en Perl,puedes acceder a un valor de la matriz dentro de las comillas dobles.Sin embargo,con PHP tendrás que encerrar tu matriz entre llaves rizadas.

trans-unit.source: As in single quoted strings, escaping any other character will result in the backslash being printed too.

trans-unit.target: A partir de 2.1.18,Yaf apoya el autocargamento de controladores para el lado de los scripts de usuario,(lo que significa el autocargamento activado por el script php de usuario,por ejemplo:acceder a una propiedad estática del controlador en Bootstrap o Plugins),pero el autocargador sólo intenta localizar el script de clase de controlador en la carpeta de módulos por defecto,que es "APPLICATION_PATH/controllers/".

As of PHP 4.3, the function more properly reflects the functionality as dictated by the » RFC2087. The array return value has changed to support an unlimited number of returned resources (i.e. messages, or sub-folders) with each named resource receiving an individual array key. Each key value then contains an another array with the usage and limit values within it.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 4.3, la función refleja más adecuadamente la funcionalidad según lo dicta »RFC2087 . El valor de retorno de la matriz ha cambiado para admitir un número ilimitado de recursos devueltos (es decir, mensajes o subcarpetas) y cada recurso nombrado recibe una clave de matriz individual. Cada valor de clave contiene otra matriz con los valores de uso y límite dentro de ella.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 4.3, this function can (potentially) work on any kind of stream. In PHP 4.3, socket based streams are still the only kind supported in the PHP core, although streams from other extensions may support this function.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 4.3,esta función puede (potencialmente)funcionar en cualquier tipo de flujo.En PHP 4.3,las secuencias basadas en sockets siguen siendo el único tipo soportado en el núcleo de PHP,aunque las secuencias de otras extensiones pueden soportar esta función.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 4.3.0 PCNTL uses ticks as the signal handle callback mechanism, which is much faster than the previous mechanism. This change follows the same semantics as using "user ticks". You must use the declare() statement to specify the locations in your program where callbacks are allowed to occur for the signal handler to function properly (as used in the example below).
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 4.3.0, PCNTL usa ticks como mecanismo de devolución de llamada del controlador de señal, que es mucho más rápido que el mecanismo anterior. Este cambio sigue la misma semántica que el uso de " ticks de usuario ". Debe usar la declaración declare () para especificar las ubicaciones en su programa donde se permite que ocurran devoluciones de llamada para que el manejador de señales funcione correctamente (como se usa en el ejemplo a continuación).

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 4.3.2, the default mode is set to binary for all platforms that distinguish between binary and text mode. If you are having problems with your scripts after upgrading, try using the 't' flag as a workaround until you have made your script more portable as mentioned before
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 4.3.2, el modo predeterminado está configurado en binario para todas las plataformas que distinguen entre modo binario y texto. Si tiene problemas con sus scripts después de la actualización, intente usar la marca 't' como solución alternativa hasta que haya hecho que su script sea más portátil como se mencionó anteriormente.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 4.3.3, calling session_start() after the session was previously started will result in an error of level E_NOTICE. Also, the second session start will simply be ignored.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5 the FILE_USE_INCLUDE_PATH constant can be used to trigger include path search. This is not possible if strict typing is enabled, since FILE_USE_INCLUDE_PATH is an int. Use TRUE instead.

As of PHP 5.0.5 the write and close handlers are called after object destruction and therefore cannot use objects or throw exceptions. Exceptions are not able to be caught since will not be caught nor will any exception trace be displayed and the execution will just cease unexpectedly. The object destructors can however use sessions.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.0.5, los manejadores de write y close se llaman después de la destrucción de objetos y, por lo tanto, no pueden usar objetos ni lanzar excepciones. Las excepciones no se pueden capturar, ya que no se detectarán ni se mostrará ningún rastro de excepción y la ejecución cesará inesperadamente. Sin embargo, los destructores de objetos pueden utilizar sesiones.

trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.1, cuando se llama sin argumentos, mktime () lanza un aviso E_STRICT : use la función time () en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.2.2, the \g escape sequence can be used for absolute and relative referencing of subpatterns. This escape sequence must be followed by an unsigned number or a negative number, optionally enclosed in braces. The sequences \1, \g1 and \g{1} are synonymous with one another. The use of this pattern with an unsigned number can help remove the ambiguity inherent when using digits following a backslash. The sequence helps to distinguish back references from octal characters and also makes it easier to have a back reference followed by a literal number, e.g. \g{2}1.

As of PHP 5.2.2, the \g escape sequence can be used for absolute and relative referencing of subpatterns. This escape sequence must be followed by an unsigned number or a negative number, optionally enclosed in braces. The sequences \1, \g1 and \g{1} are synonymous with one another. The use of this pattern with an unsigned number can help remove the ambiguity inherent when using digits following a backslash. The sequence helps to distinguish back references from octal characters and also makes it easier to have a back reference followed by a literal number, e.g. \g{2}1.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.2.2, la secuencia de escape \ g se puede utilizar para hacer referencia absoluta y relativa a subpatrones. Esta secuencia de escape debe ir seguida de un número sin signo o un número negativo, opcionalmente entre llaves. Las secuencias \ 1 , \ g1 y \ g {1} son sinónimos entre sí. El uso de este patrón con un número sin firmar puede ayudar a eliminar la ambigüedad inherente al usar dígitos después de una barra invertida. La secuencia ayuda a distinguir las referencias inversas de los caracteres octales y también hace que sea más fácil tener una referencia inversa seguida de un número literal, por ejemplo, \ g {2} 1 .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.3.0 is_callable() reports constructors as not being callable. This affects PHP 5 style constructors (__construct) as well as PHP 4 style constructors (i.e. methods with the same name as the class). Formerly, both cases have been considered callable.

As of PHP 5.3.0 is_callable() reports constructors as not being callable. This affects PHP 5 style constructors (__construct) as well as PHP 4 style constructors (i.e. methods with the same name as the class). Formerly, both cases have been considered callable.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.3.0, is_callable () informa que los constructores no son invocables. Esto afecta a los constructores de estilo PHP 5 ( __construct ) así como a los constructores de estilo PHP 4 (es decir, métodos con el mismo nombre que la clase). Anteriormente, ambos casos se consideraban invocables.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.3.0, the stream_context_set_default() function can be used to set the default context.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.3.0, la función stream_context_set_default () se puede utilizar para establecer el contexto predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.3.3, methods with the same name as the last element of a namespaced class name will no longer be treated as constructor. This change doesn't affect non-namespaced classes.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.3.3,los métodos con el mismo nombre que el último elemento de una clase con nombre ya no serán tratados como constructor.Este cambio no afecta a las clases sin nombre.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4 it is possible to array dereference the result of a function or method call directly. Before it was only possible using a temporary variable.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4 es posible organizar directamente la derivación del resultado de una llamada a una función o método.Antes sólo era posible usando una variable temporal.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4 string offsets have to either be integers or integer-like strings, otherwise a warning will be thrown. Previously an offset like "foo" was silently cast to 0.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4, las compensaciones de cadenas deben ser enteras o cadenas de tipo entero; de lo contrario, se lanzará una advertencia. Anteriormente, un desplazamiento como "foo" se convertía silenciosamente en 0 .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4 you can also use the short array syntax, which replaces array() with [].
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4 también puede usar la sintaxis de matriz corta, que reemplaza matriz () con [] .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4, anonymous functions may be declared statically. This prevents them from having the current class automatically bound to them. Objects may also not be bound to them at runtime.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4,las funciones anónimas pueden ser declaradas estáticamente.Esto evita que la clase actual se vincule automáticamente a ellas.Los objetos también pueden no estar vinculados a ellos en tiempo de ejecución.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4.0 you can use session_register_shutdown() or simply use the 'register shutdown' flag when invoking session_set_save_handler() using the OOP method and passing an instance that implements SessionHandlerInterface.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4.0, puede usar session_register_shutdown () o simplemente usar el indicador 'register shutdown' al invocar session_set_save_handler () usando el método OOP y pasando una instancia que implementa SessionHandlerInterface .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4.0, PHP implements a method of code reuse called Traits.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4.0,PHP implementa un método de reutilización de código llamado Traits.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4.0, when declared in the context of a class, the current class is automatically bound to it, making $this available inside of the function's scope. If this automatic binding of the current class is not wanted, then static anonymous functions may be used instead.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4.0, cuando se declara en el contexto de una clase, la clase actual se vincula automáticamente a ella, lo que hace que $ this esté disponible dentro del alcance de la función. Si no se desea este enlace automático de la clase actual, se pueden usar funciones anónimas estáticas .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.4.0, you can call any callable stored in a variable.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.4.0, puede llamar a cualquier invocable almacenado en una variable.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.5 it is possible to array dereference an array literal.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.5 es posible hacer una matriz de derivación de una matriz literal.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 5.6.1 can also be specified as INI_SCANNER_TYPED. In this mode boolean, null and integer types are preserved when possible. String values "true", "on" and "yes" are converted to true. "false", "off", "no" and "none" are considered false. "null" is converted to null in typed mode. Also, all numeric strings are converted to integer type if it is possible.

As of PHP 5.6.1 can also be specified as INI_SCANNER_TYPED. In this mode boolean, null and integer types are preserved when possible. String values "true", "on" and "yes" are converted to TRUE. "false", "off", "no" and "none" are considered FALSE. "null" is converted to NULL in typed mode. Also, all numeric strings are converted to integer type if it is possible.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 5.6.1 también se puede especificar como INI_SCANNER_TYPED . En este modo, los tipos booleanos, nulos y enteros se conservan cuando es posible. Los valores de cadena "true" , "on" y "yes" se convierten a TRUE . "falso" , "desactivado" , "no" y "ninguno" se consideran FALSE . "null" se convierte a NULL en modo escrito. Además, todas las cadenas numéricas se convierten a tipo entero si es posible.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.0.0, instead of being undefined and platform-dependent, NaN and Infinity will always be zero when cast to integer.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.0.0, en lugar de ser indefinidos y dependientes de la plataforma, NaN e Infinity siempre serán cero cuando se conviertan en números enteros .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.0.7, if type is omitted, it is automatically detected from the type of the param: boolean and integer are treated as SQLITE3_INTEGER, float as SQLITE3_FLOAT, null as SQLITE3_NULL and all others as SQLITE3_TEXT. Formerly, if type has been omitted, it has defaulted to SQLITE3_TEXT.

Anteriormente, si type se ha omitido, se cambia automáticamente a SQLITE3_TEXT .

As of PHP 7.1.0 list() can now also contain explicit keys, which can be given as arbitrary expressions. Mixing of integer and string keys is allowed; however, elements with and without keys cannot be mixed.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.1.0, list () ahora también puede contener claves explícitas, que se pueden dar como expresiones arbitrarias. Se permite la mezcla de claves enteras y de cadena; sin embargo, los elementos con y sin llaves no se pueden mezclar.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0 also negative numeric indices are supported.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.1.0 también se admiten índices numéricos negativos .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0 the handler callback is given a second argument containing the siginfo of the specific signal. This data is only supplied if the operating system has the siginfo_t structure. If the OS does not implement siginfo_t NULL is supplied.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0 visibility modifiers are allowed for class constants.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.1.0 se permiten modificadores de visibilidad para las constantes de clase.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0, ReflectionType::__toString() is deprecated, and ReflectionParameter::getType()may return an instance of ReflectionNamedType. To get the name of the parameter type, ReflectionNamedType() is available in this case.
As of PHP 7.1.0, a catch block may specify multiple exceptions using the pipe (|) character. This is useful for when different exceptions from different class hierarchies are handled the same.

As of PHP 7.1.0, an ArgumentCountError will be thrown if the callback function requires more than 2 parameters (the value and key of the array member). Previously, if the callback function required more than 2 parameters, an error of level E_WARNING would be generated each time array_walk() calls callback.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.1.0, se lanzará un ArgumentCountError si la función de callback requiere más de 2 parámetros (el valor y la clave del miembro de la matriz). Anteriormente, si la función de callback requería más de 2 parámetros, se generaba un error de nivel E_WARNING cada vez que array_walk () llama a la callback .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0, an ArgumentCountError will be thrown if the callback function requires more than 2 parameters (the value and key of the array member). Previously, if the callback function required more than 2 parameters, an error of level E_WARNING would be generated each time array_walk() calls callback.
As of PHP 7.1.0, class constants may be defined as public, private, or protected. Constants declared without any explicit visibility keyword are defined as public.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.1.0,las constantes de clase pueden ser definidas como públicas,privadas o protegidas.Las constantes declaradas sin ninguna palabra clave de visibilidad explícita se definen como públicas.

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.1.0, return statements without an argument trigger E_COMPILE_ERROR, unless the return type is void, in which case return statements with an argument trigger that error.
As of PHP 7.1.0, type declarations can be marked nullable by prefixing the type name with a question mark (?). This signifies that the value can be of the specified type or null.

As of PHP 7.2.0 and libzip 1.2.0 the password is used to decompress the archive, and is also the default password for ZipArchive::setEncryptionName() and ZipArchive::setEncryptionIndex(). Formerly, this function only set the password to be used to decompress the archive; it did not turn a non-password-protected ZipArchive into a password-protected ZipArchive.
trans-unit.target: A partir de PHP 7.2.0 y libzip 1.2.0, la contraseña se utiliza para descomprimir el archivo y también es la contraseña predeterminada para ZipArchive :: setEncryptionName () y ZipArchive :: setEncryptionIndex () . Anteriormente, esta función solo configuraba la contraseña que se utilizaría para descomprimir el archivo; no resultó un protegido con contraseña en ZipArchive en una protegida por contraseña ZipArchive .

trans-unit.source: As of PHP 7.2.0, instead of the missspelled RefectionClass::isIterateable(), ReflectionClass::isIterable() should be preferred.
As of PHP 7.3.0, constants are allowed on the left-hand-side of the instanceof operator.

As of PHP 7.4.0, uopz_extends() throws a RuntimeException, if OPcache is enabled, and the class entry of either class or parent (if it is a trait) is immutable.
As of PHP 7.4.0, uopz_implements() throws a RuntimeException, if OPcache is enabled, and the class entry of class is immutable.

As of PHP 7.4.0, integer literals may contain underscores (_) between digits, for better readability of literals. These underscores are removed by PHP's scanner.
As of PHP 7.4.0, property definitions can include a type declaration.

As of PHP 8.0.0, constructor parameters may also be promoted to correspond to an object property. It is very common for constructor parameters to be assigned to a property in the constructor but otherwise not operated upon. Constructor promotion provides a short-hand for that use case. The example above could be rewritten as the following.

As of PHP 8.0.0, passing mandatory arguments after optional arguments is deprecated. This can generally be resolved by dropping the default value. One exception to this rule are arguments of the form Type $param = null, where the null default makes the type implicitly nullable. This usage remains allowed, though it is recommended to use an explicit nullable type instead.

As of PHP 8.0.0, properties and methods may also be accessed with the "nullsafe" operator instead: ?->. The nullsafe operator works the same as property or method access as above, except that if the object being dereferenced is null then null will be returned rather than an exception thrown. If the dereference is part of a chain, the rest of the chain is skipped.
As of PHP 8.0.0, the throw keyword is an expression and may be used in any expression context. In prior versions it was a statement and was required to be on its own line.
As of PHP 8.0.0, the ::class constant may also be used on objects. This resolution happens at runtime, not compile time. Its effect is the same as calling get_class() on the object.
As of PHP 8.0.0, the decimal point character is always .. Prior to PHP 8.0.0, the decimal point character is defined in the script's locale (category LC_NUMERIC). See the setlocale() function.

As of PHP 8.0.0, the list of function arguments may include a trailing comma, which will be ignored. That is particularly useful in cases where the list of arguments is long or contains long variable names, making it convenient to list arguments vertically.
As of PHP 8.0.0, the list of scope-inherited variables may include a trailing comma, which will be ignored.
As of PHP 8.0.0, the variable name for a caught exception is optional. If not specified, the catch block will still execute but will not have access to the thrown object.

As of runkit version 0.5, certain Sandbox settings may be modified on the fly using ArrayAccess syntax. Some settings, such as active are read-only and meant to provide status information. Other settings, such as output_handler may be set and read much like a normal array offset. Future settings may be write-only, however no such settings currently exist.
trans-unit.target: A partir de la versión 0.5 de runkit, ciertas configuraciones de Sandbox pueden modificarse sobre la marcha utilizando la sintaxis de ArrayAccess. Algunas configuraciones, como active son de solo lectura y están diseñadas para proporcionar información de estado. Otras configuraciones, como output_handler , pueden establecerse y leerse de forma muy similar a un desplazamiento de matriz normal. Las configuraciones futuras pueden ser de solo escritura, sin embargo, actualmente no existen tales configuraciones.

trans-unit.source: As of runkit version 0.5, this function is deprecated and is scheduled to be removed from the package prior to a 1.0 release. The output handler for a given Runkit_Sandbox instance may be read/set using the array offset syntax shown on the Runkit_Sandbox class definition page.
trans-unit.target: A partir de la versión 0.5 de runkit, esta función está obsoleta y está programada para ser eliminada del paquete antes de la versión 1.0. El controlador de salida para una instancia de Runkit_Sandbox determinada puede leerse / configurarse utilizando la sintaxis de desplazamiento de matriz que se muestra en la página de definición de la clase Runkit_Sandbox .

trans-unit.source: As the Error hierarchy does not inherit from Exception, code that uses catch (Exception $e) { ... } blocks to handle uncaught exceptions in PHP 5 will find that these Errors are not caught by these blocks. Either a catch (Error $e) { ... } block or a set_exception_handler() handler is required.
trans-unit.target: Como la jerarquía de errores no hereda de Exception , el código que usa bloques catch (Exception $e) { ... } para manejar excepciones no detectadas en PHP 5 encontrará que estos errores no son detectados por estos bloques. Se requiere un bloque catch (Error $e) { ... } o un controlador set_exception_handler () .

trans-unit.source: As the output is dependent upon the underlying C library, some conversion specifiers are not supported. On Windows, supplying unknown conversion specifiers will result in 5 E_WARNING messages and return FALSE. On other operating systems you may not get any E_WARNING messages and the output may contain the conversion specifiers unconverted.
trans-unit.target: Como la salida depende de la biblioteca C subyacente, no se admiten algunos especificadores de conversión. En Windows, el suministro de especificadores de conversión desconocidos dará como resultado 5 mensajes E_WARNING y devolverá FALSE . En otros sistemas operativos, es posible que no reciba ningún mensaje E_WARNING y la salida puede contener los especificadores de conversión sin convertir.

As with normal exceptions, these Error exceptions will bubble up until they reach the first matching catch block. If there are no matching blocks, then any default exception handler installed with set_exception_handler() will be called, and if there is no default exception handler, then the exception will be converted to a fatal error and will be handled like a traditional error.

As with normal exceptions, these Error exceptions will bubble up until they reach the first matching catch block. If there are no matching blocks, then any default exception handler installed with set_exception_handler() will be called, and if there is no default exception handler, then the exception will be converted to a fatal error and will be handled like a traditional error.
trans-unit.target: Como ocurre con las excepciones normales, estas excepciones de error aparecerán hasta que alcancen el primer bloque de captura coincidente . Si no hay bloques coincidentes, se llamará a cualquier controlador de excepciones predeterminado instalado con set_exception_handler () , y si no hay un controlador de excepciones predeterminado, la excepción se convertirá en un error fatal y se manejará como un error tradicional.

trans-unit.source: As with timers, the callback is guaranteed to be invoked only when the point in time where it is supposed to trigger has passed. If multiple timers become ready during the same loop iteration then the ones with earlier time-out values are invoked before ones with later time-out values (but this is no longer true when a callback calls EvLoop::run() recursively).
trans-unit.target: Al igual que con los temporizadores, se garantiza que la devolución de llamada se invocará solo cuando haya pasado el momento en el que se supone que debe activarse. Si varios temporizadores están listos durante la misma iteración de bucle, los que tienen valores de tiempo de espera anteriores se invocan antes que los que tienen valores de tiempo de espera posteriores (pero esto ya no es cierto cuando una devolución de llamada llama a EvLoop :: run () de forma recursiva).

trans-unit.source: Assertion subpatterns are not capturing subpatterns, and may not be repeated, because it makes no sense to assert the same thing several times. If any kind of assertion contains capturing subpatterns within it, these are counted for the purposes of numbering the capturing subpatterns in the whole pattern. However, substring capturing is carried out only for positive assertions, because it does not make sense for negative assertions.
trans-unit.target: Los subpatrones de afirmación no capturan subpatrones,y pueden no ser repetidos,porque no tiene sentido afirmar la misma cosa varias veces.Si algún tipo de afirmación contiene subpatrones de captura dentro de ella,éstos se cuentan a efectos de numerar los subpatrones de captura en el patrón completo.Sin embargo,la captura de subcadenas se lleva a cabo sólo para afirmaciones positivas,porque no tiene sentido para las afirmaciones negativas.

trans-unit.source: Assertions can be nested in any combination. For example, (?<=(?<!foo)bar)baz matches an occurrence of "baz" that is preceded by "bar" which in turn is not preceded by "foo", while (?<=\d{3}...(?<!999))foo is another pattern which matches "foo" preceded by three digits and any three characters that are not "999".

Assertions can be nested in any combination. For example, (?<=(?<!foo)bar)baz matches an occurrence of "baz" that is preceded by "bar" which in turn is not preceded by "foo", while (?<=\d{3}...(?<!999))foo is another pattern which matches "foo" preceded by three digits and any three characters that are not "999".
trans-unit.target: Las afirmaciones se pueden anidar en cualquier combinación. Por ejemplo, (? <= (? <! Foo) bar) baz coincide con una aparición de "baz" que está precedida por "bar", que a su vez no está precedida por "foo", mientras que (? <= \ D {3 } ... (? <! 999)) foo es otro patrón que coincide con "foo" precedido por tres dígitos y tres caracteres que no sean "999".

trans-unit.source: Assertions count towards the maximum of 200 parenthesized subpatterns.
trans-unit.target: Las afirmaciones cuentan para el máximo de 200 subpatrones entre paréntesis.

trans-unit.source: Assertions should be used as a debugging feature only. You may use them for sanity-checks that test for conditions that should always be TRUE and that indicate some programming errors if not or to check for the presence of certain features like extension functions or certain system limits and features.
trans-unit.target: Las afirmaciones deben usarse solo como una función de depuración. Puede usarlos para verificaciones de cordura que prueban condiciones que siempre deberían ser TRUE y que indican algunos errores de programación en caso contrario o para verificar la presencia de ciertas características como funciones de extensión o ciertos límites y características del sistema.

trans-unit.source: Assertions should be used as a debugging feature only. You may use them for sanity-checks that test for conditions that should always be true and that indicate some programming errors if not or to check for the presence of certain features like extension functions or certain system limits and features.
Assertions should not be used for normal runtime operations like input parameter checks. As a rule of thumb your code should always be able to work correctly if assertion checking is not activated.
trans-unit.target: Las afirmaciones no deben utilizarse para operaciones normales de tiempo de ejecución como las comprobaciones de los parámetros de entrada.Como regla general,el código debería funcionar siempre correctamente si no se activa la comprobación de aserciones.

Assuming you're familiar with the concept of functions (if you're not, take a look at the chapter about functions), you'd assume that typing $c = foo() is essentially just like writing $c = 5, and you're right. Functions are expressions with the value of their return value. Since foo() returns 5, the value of the expression 'foo()' is 5. Usually functions don't just return a static value but compute something.
trans-unit.target: Suponiendo que esté familiarizado con el concepto de funciones (si no lo está, eche un vistazo al capítulo sobre funciones ), asumiría que escribir $ c = foo () es esencialmente como escribir $ c = 5 , y tienes razón. Las funciones son expresiones con el valor de su valor de retorno. Como foo () devuelve 5, el valor de la expresión ' foo () ' es 5. Por lo general, las funciones no solo devuelven un valor estático, sino que calculan algo.

trans-unit.source: Assuming you're familiar with the concept of functions (if you're not, take a look at the chapter about functions), you'd assume that typing $c = foo() is essentially just like writing $c = 5, and you're right. Functions are expressions with the value of their return value. Since foo() returns 5, the value of the expression 'foo()' is 5. Usually functions don't just return a static value but compute something.

trans-unit.source: Attributes allow to add structured, machine-readable metadata information on declarations in code: Classes, methods, functions, parameters, properties and class constants can be the target of an attribute. The metadata defined by attributes can then be inspected at runtime using the Reflection APIs. Attributes could therefore be thought of as a configuration language embedded directly into code.

trans-unit.source: Avoid using this function in multithreaded webservers. It is better to change the file permissions with chmod() after creating the file. Using umask() can lead to unexpected behavior of concurrently running scripts and the webserver itself because they all use the same umask.

El uso de umask () puede provocar un comportamiento inesperado de los scripts que se ejecutan simultáneamente y del servidor web mismo porque todos usan la misma umask.

trans-unit.source: Be aware that some socket implementations need to be handled very carefully. A few basic rules:
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que algunas implementaciones de enchufes deben ser manejadas con mucho cuidado.Unas cuantas reglas básicas:

trans-unit.source: Be careful about variables that may match HTML entities. Things like &amp, &copy and &pound are parsed by the browser and the actual entity is used instead of the desired variable name. This is an obvious hassle that the W3C has been telling people about for years. The reference is here: » http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#h-B.2.2.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado con las variables que pueden coincidir con entidades HTML. Cosas como & amp, & copy y & pound son analizadas por el navegador y se usa la entidad real en lugar del nombre de variable deseado. Este es un problema obvio del que el W3C ha estado hablando a la gente durante años. La referencia está aquí: »http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#hB.2.2 .

trans-unit.source: Be careful if you choose to escape characters 0, a, b, f, n, r, t and v. They will be converted to \0, \a, \b, \f, \n, \r, \t and \v, all of which are predefined escape sequences in C. Many of these sequences are also defined in other C-derived languages, including PHP, meaning that you may not get the desired result if you use the output of addcslashes() to generate code in those languages with these characters defined in characters.

Be careful if you choose to escape characters 0, a, b, f, n, r, t and v. They will be converted to \0, \a, \b, \f, \n, \r, \t and \v, all of which are predefined escape sequences in C. Many of these sequences are also defined in other C-derived languages, including PHP, meaning that you may not get the desired result if you use the output of addcslashes() to generate code in those languages with these characters defined in charlist.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado si elige escapar los caracteres 0, a, b, f, n, r, t y v. Se convertirán a \ 0, \ a, \ b, \ f, \ n, \ r, \ t y \ v, todas las cuales son secuencias de escape predefinidas en C. Muchas de estas secuencias también están definidas en otros lenguajes derivados de C, incluido PHP, lo que significa que es posible que no obtenga el resultado deseado si usa la salida de addcslashes () para generar código en aquellos idiomas con estos caracteres definidos en charlist .

trans-unit.source: Be careful when passing arguments with mixed types values because max() can produce unpredictable results.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado al pasar argumentos con valores de tipos mixtos porque max () puede producir resultados impredecibles.

trans-unit.source: Be careful when passing arguments with mixed types values because min() can produce unpredictable results.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado al pasar argumentos con valores de tipos mixtos porque min () puede producir resultados impredecibles.

trans-unit.source: Be careful when sorting arrays with mixed types values because sort() can produce unexpected results, if flags is SORT_REGULAR,
Be careful when sorting arrays with mixed types values because sort() can produce unpredictable results.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado al ordenar matrices con valores de tipos mixtos porque sort () puede producir resultados impredecibles.

trans-unit.source: Be careful when using array syntax. Scalar keys will be coerced to integers by the engine. For example, $map["1"] will attempt to access int(1), while $map->get("1") will correctly look up the string key.
trans-unit.target: Tenga cuidado al utilizar la sintaxis de matriz. Las claves escalares serán convertidas en números enteros por el motor. Por ejemplo, $map["1"] intentará acceder a int(1) , mientras que $map->get("1") buscará correctamente la clave de cadena.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to read the note about escaping namespace names in strings.
trans-unit.target: Asegúrese de leer la nota sobre cómo escapar de los nombres de espacios de nombres en cadenas .

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use the === operator when checking for an error. Since the socket_select() may return 0 the comparison with == would evaluate to true:
Be sure to use the === operator when checking for an error. Since the stream_select() may return 0 the comparison with == would evaluate to true:
Be sure to use the === operator when checking for an error. Since the socket_select() may return 0 the comparison with == would evaluate to TRUE:
trans-unit.target: Asegúrese de utilizar el operador === cuando busque un error. Dado que socket_select () puede devolver 0, la comparación con == se evaluaría como TRUE :

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use the === operator when checking for an error. Since the stream_select() may return 0 the comparison with == would evaluate to TRUE:
trans-unit.target: Asegúrese de utilizar el operador === cuando busque un error. Dado que stream_select () puede devolver 0, la comparación con == se evaluaría como TRUE :

trans-unit.source: Became available when using Apache 1, or the PHP Apache 2 filter API. Before this time, it was only available when using the Apache 2 handler API.
trans-unit.target: Se volvió disponible al usar Apache 1 o la API de filtro PHP Apache 2 . Antes de este tiempo, solo estaba disponible cuando se usaba la API del controlador de Apache 2 .

trans-unit.source: Because pg_query() and pg_query_params() return FALSE if the query fails, you must use pg_send_query() and pg_get_result() to get the result handle.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que pg_query () y pg_query_params () devuelven FALSE si la consulta falla, debe usar pg_send_query () y pg_get_result () para obtener el identificador de resultado.

trans-unit.source: Because pg_query() and pg_query_params() return false if the query fails, you must use pg_send_query() and pg_get_result() to get the result handle.
Because pg_query() returns FALSE if the query fails, you must use pg_send_query() and pg_get_result() to get the result handle.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que pg_query () devuelve FALSE si la consulta falla, debe usar pg_send_query () y pg_get_result () para obtener el identificador de resultado.

trans-unit.source: Because pg_query() returns false if the query fails, you must use pg_send_query() and pg_get_result() to get the result handle.
Because variable variables may not be used with PHP's Superglobal arrays within functions, the Superglobal arrays may not be passed into compact().
trans-unit.target: Debido a que las variables variables no se pueden usar con las matrices Superglobal de PHP dentro de las funciones, las matrices Superglobal no se pueden pasar a compact () .

trans-unit.source: Because include is a special language construct, parentheses are not needed around its argument. Take care when comparing return value.
Because include is a special language construct, parentheses are not needed around its argument. Take care when comparing return value.
trans-unit.target: Dado que include es una construcción de lenguaje especial, no se necesitan paréntesis alrededor de su argumento. Tenga cuidado al comparar el valor de retorno.

trans-unit.source: Because NAN represents any number of different values, NAN should not be compared to other values, including itself, and instead should be checked for using is_nan().
trans-unit.target: Debido a que NAN representa cualquier número de valores diferentes, NAN no debe compararse con otros valores, incluido él mismo, sino que debe verificarse para usar is_nan () .

trans-unit.source: Because flock() requires a file pointer, you may have to use a special lock file to protect access to a file that you intend to truncate by opening it in write mode (with a "w" or "w+" argument to fopen()).
trans-unit.target: Debido a que flock () requiere un puntero de archivo, es posible que deba usar un archivo de bloqueo especial para proteger el acceso a un archivo que desea truncar abriéndolo en modo de escritura (con un argumento "w" o "w +" para fopen () ).

trans-unit.source: Because str_ireplace() replaces left to right, it might replace a previously inserted value when doing multiple replacements. Example #2 in the str_replace() documentation demonstrates how this may affect you in practice.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que str_ireplace () reemplaza de izquierda a derecha, podría reemplazar un valor previamente insertado al realizar múltiples reemplazos. El ejemplo # 2 en la documentación de str_replace () demuestra cómo esto puede afectarlo en la práctica.

trans-unit.source: Because str_replace() replaces left to right, it might replace a previously inserted value when doing multiple replacements. See also the examples in this document.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que str_replace () reemplaza de izquierda a derecha, podría reemplazar un valor previamente insertado al realizar múltiples reemplazos. Consulte también los ejemplos de este documento.

trans-unit.source: Because strip_tags() does not actually validate the HTML, partial or broken tags can result in the removal of more text/data than expected.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que strip_tags () en realidad no valida el HTML, las etiquetas parciales o rotas pueden resultar en la eliminación de más texto / datos de lo esperado.

trans-unit.source: Because trim() trims characters from the beginning and end of a string, it may be confusing when characters are (or are not) removed from the middle. trim('abc', 'bad') removes both 'a' and 'b' because it trims 'a' thus moving 'b' to the beginning to also be trimmed. So, this is why it "works" whereas trim('abc', 'b') seemingly does not.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que trim () recorta los caracteres del principio y el final de una cadena , puede resultar confuso cuando los caracteres se eliminan (o no) del medio. trim ('abc', 'bad') elimina tanto 'a' como 'b' porque recorta 'a' moviendo así 'b' al principio para ser recortado también. Entonces, esta es la razón por la que "funciona" mientras que trim ('abc', 'b') aparentemente no lo hace.

trans-unit.source: Because trim() trims characters from the beginning and end of a string, it may be confusing when characters are (or are not) removed from the middle. trim('abc', 'bad') removes both 'a' and 'b' because it trims 'a' thus moving 'b' to the beginning to also be trimmed. So, this is why it "works" whereas trim('abc', 'b') seemingly does not.

Because PHP determines the types of variables and converts them (generally) as needed, it is not always obvious what type a given variable is at any one time. PHP includes several functions which find out what type a variable is, such as: gettype(), is_array(), is_float(), is_int(), is_object(), and is_string(). See also the chapter on Types.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que PHP determina los tipos de variables y las convierte (generalmente) según sea necesario, no siempre es obvio qué tipo es una variable dada en un momento dado. PHP incluye varias funciones que descubren de qué tipo es una variable, tales como: gettype () , is_array () , is_float () , is_int () , is_object () e is_string () . Consulte también el capítulo sobre tipos .

trans-unit.source: Because PHP determines the types of variables and converts them (generally) as needed, it is not always obvious what type a given variable is at any one time. PHP includes several functions which find out what type a variable is, such as: gettype(), is_array(), is_float(), is_int(), is_object(), and is_string(). See also the chapter on Types.

Because PHP's integer type is signed, and many IP addresses will result in negative integers on 32-bit architectures, you need to use the "%u" formatter of sprintf() or printf() to get the string representation of the unsigned IP address.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que el tipo de entero de PHP está firmado y muchas direcciones IP darán como resultado números enteros negativos en arquitecturas de 32 bits, debe usar el formateador "% u" de sprintf () o printf () para obtener la representación de cadena de la dirección IP sin firmar .

trans-unit.source: Because PHP's int type is signed, and many IP addresses will result in negative integers on 32-bit architectures, you need to use the "%u" formatter of sprintf() or printf() to get the string representation of the unsigned IP address.
Because PHP's integer type is signed many crc32 checksums will result in negative integers on 32bit platforms. On 64bit installations all crc32() results will be positive integers though.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que el tipo de entero de PHP está firmado, muchas sumas de comprobación crc32 darán como resultado enteros negativos en plataformas de 32 bits. En instalaciones de 64 bits, todos los resultados de crc32 () serán enteros positivos.

trans-unit.source: Because assigning an array to another variable resets the original array's pointer, our example above would cause an endless loop had we assigned <var>$fruit</var> to another variable inside the loop.

Because assigning an array to another variable resets the original array's pointer, our example above would cause an endless loop had we assigned <var><var>$fruit</var></var> to another variable inside the loop.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que la asignación de una matriz a otra variable restablece el puntero de la matriz original, nuestro ejemplo anterior provocaría un ciclo sin fin si hubiéramos asignado <var><var>$fruit</var></var> a otra variable dentro del ciclo.

trans-unit.source: Because every system is setup differently, phpinfo() is commonly used to check configuration settings and for available predefined variables on a given system.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que cada sistema se configura de manera diferente, phpinfo () se usa comúnmente para verificar los ajustes de configuración y las variables predefinidas disponibles en un sistema dado.

trans-unit.source: Because every system is setup differently, phpinfo() is commonly used to check configuration settings and for available predefined variables on a given system.
Because of eccentricities in the performance of libresolv between platforms, DNS_ANY will not always return every record, the slower DNS_ALL will collect all records more reliably.
trans-unit.target: Debido a las excentricidades en el rendimiento de libresolv entre plataformas, DNS_ANY no siempre devolverá todos los registros, el DNS_ALL más lento recopilará todos los registros de manera más confiable.

trans-unit.source: Because of the way floats are represented internally, you should not test two floats for equality.
trans-unit.target: Debido a la forma en que los float s se representan internamente, no debe probar la igualdad de dos float s.

trans-unit.source: Because of the way floats are represented internally, you should not test two floats for equality.
Because setting a cookie with a value of FALSE will try to delete the cookie, you should not use boolean values. Instead, use 0 for FALSE and 1 for TRUE.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que establecer una cookie con un valor de FALSE intentará eliminar la cookie, no debe usar valores booleanos. En su lugar, use 0 para FALSE y 1 para TRUE .

trans-unit.source: Because setting a cookie with a value of false will try to delete the cookie, you should not use boolean values. Instead, use 0 for false and 1 for true.
Because static methods are callable without an instance of the object created, the pseudo-variable <var>$this</var> is not available inside the method declared as static.
Because static methods are callable without an instance of the object created, the pseudo-variable <var><var>$this</var></var> is not available inside the method declared as static.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que los métodos estáticos son invocables sin una instancia del objeto creado, la pseudovariable <var><var>$this</var></var> no está disponible dentro del método declarado como estático.

trans-unit.source: Because the SessionHandler wraps the current internal save handler methods, the above example of encryption can be applied to any internal save handler without having to know the internals of the handlers.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que SessionHandler envuelve los métodos actuales del manejador de guardado interno, el ejemplo anterior de cifrado se puede aplicar a cualquier manejador de guardado interno sin tener que conocer los aspectos internos de los manejadores.

trans-unit.source: Because the effects may vary depending on the ODBC driver, use of this function in scripts to be made publicly available is strongly discouraged. Also, some ODBC options are not available to this function because they must be set before the connection is established or the query is prepared. However, if on a particular job it can make PHP work so your boss doesn't tell you to use a commercial product, that's all that really matters.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que los efectos pueden variar dependiendo del controlador ODBC,se desaconseja encarecidamente el uso de esta función en los guiones que se pongan a disposición del público.Además,algunas opciones de ODBC no están disponibles para esta función porque deben ser configuradas antes de que se establezca la conexión o se prepare la consulta.Sin embargo,si en un trabajo en particular puede hacer que PHP funcione para que su jefe no le diga que use un producto comercial,eso es todo lo que realmente importa.

trans-unit.source: Because the value of an array can be anything, it can also be another array. This enables the creation of recursive and multi-dimensional arrays.
trans-unit.target: Dado que el valor de una matriz puede ser cualquier cosa, también puede ser otra matriz . Esto permite la creación de matrices recursivas y multidimensionales .

trans-unit.source: Because the value of an array can be anything, it can also be another array. This enables the creation of recursive and multi-dimensional arrays.
Because there are so many methods, here is a handy list of methods, somewhat reduced to their general purpose:
trans-unit.target: Debido a que hay tantos métodos,aquí hay una lista útil de métodos,algo reducida a su propósito general:

trans-unit.source: Because this function depends on the current scope to determine parameter details, it cannot be used as a function parameter in versions prior to 5.3.0. If this value must be passed, the results should be assigned to a variable, and that variable should be passed.
trans-unit.target: Dado que esta función depende del alcance actual para determinar los detalles de los parámetros,no puede utilizarse como parámetro de función en las versiones anteriores a la 5.3.0.Si hay que pasar este valor,los resultados deben asignarse a una variable,y esa variable debe pasarse.

trans-unit.source: Because this method uses the modulus operation, numbers which are not positive integers may give unexpected results.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que este método utiliza la operación de módulo,los números que no son enteros positivos pueden dar resultados inesperados.

trans-unit.source: Because variables in PHP can't have dots and spaces in their names, those are converted to underscores. Same applies to naming of respective key names in case of using this function with result parameter.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que las variables en PHP no pueden tener puntos y espacios en sus nombres, estos se convierten en guiones bajos. Lo mismo se aplica a la asignación de nombres de los respectivos nombres de teclas en caso de utilizar esta función con el parámetro de result ado .

trans-unit.source: Before 5.3.6, the only values recognized are TRUE or FALSE, which are the same as setting or not setting the DEBUG_BACKTRACE_PROVIDE_OBJECT option respectively.
trans-unit.target: Antes de 5.3.6, los únicos valores reconocidos son TRUE o FALSE , que son los mismos que configurar o no configurar la opción DEBUG_BACKTRACE_PROVIDE_OBJECT respectivamente.

trans-unit.source: Before 5.3.6, the only values recognized are true or false, which are the same as setting or not setting the DEBUG_BACKTRACE_PROVIDE_OBJECT option respectively.
Before PHP 5.1.0, negative timestamps were not supported under any known version of Windows and some other systems as well. Therefore the range of valid years was limited to 1970 through 2038.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.1.0,las marcas de tiempo negativas no eran soportadas por ninguna versión conocida de Windows y algunos otros sistemas también.Por lo tanto,el rango de años válidos se limitaba a 1970 hasta 2038.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.1.0, this function returned TRUE when text was an empty string.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.1.0, esta función devolvía TRUE cuando el text o era una cadena vacía.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.3.4, on Windows, sleep() always returns NULL when sleep has occurred, regardless of whether the sleep was interrupted or not.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.3.4, en Windows, sleep () siempre devuelve NULL cuando se ha producido la suspensión, independientemente de si la suspensión se interrumpió o no.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.4, referenced variables in param_arr are passed to the function by reference, regardless of whether the function expects the respective parameter to be passed by reference. This form of call-time pass by reference does not emit a deprecation notice, but it is nonetheless deprecated, and has been removed in PHP 5.4. Furthermore, this does not apply to internal functions, for which the function signature is honored. Passing by value when the function expects a parameter by reference results in a warning and having call_user_func() return FALSE (there is, however, an exception for passed values with reference count = 1, such as in literals, as these can be turned into references without ill effects — but also without writes to that value having any effect —; do not rely in this behavior, though, as the reference count is an implementation detail and the soundness of this behavior is questionable).
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.4, las variables referenciadas en param_arr se pasan a la función por referencia, independientemente de si la función espera que el parámetro respectivo se pase por referencia. Esta forma de pasar el tiempo de llamada por referencia no emite un aviso de obsolescencia, pero, no obstante, está obsoleta y se ha eliminado en PHP 5.4. Además, esto no se aplica a las funciones internas, para las cuales se respeta la firma de la función. Pasar por valor cuando la función espera un parámetro por referencia da como resultado una advertencia y hacer que call_user_func () devuelva FALSE (hay, sin embargo, una excepción para los valores pasados ​​con recuento de referencias = 1, como en los literales, ya que estos pueden convertirse en referencias sin efectos nocivos, pero también sin que las escrituras en ese valor tengan ningún efecto; no confíe en esto comportamiento, sin embargo, ya que el recuento de referencias es un detalle de implementación y la solidez de este comportamiento es cuestionable).

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.4, referenced variables in param_arr are passed to the function by reference, regardless of whether the function expects the respective parameter to be passed by reference. This form of call-time pass by reference does not emit a deprecation notice, but it is nonetheless deprecated, and has been removed in PHP 5.4. Furthermore, this does not apply to internal functions, for which the function signature is honored. Passing by value when the function expects a parameter by reference results in a warning and having call_user_func() return false (there is, however, an exception for passed values with reference count = 1, such as in literals, as these can be turned into references without ill effects — but also without writes to that value having any effect —; do not rely in this behavior, though, as the reference count is an implementation detail and the soundness of this behavior is questionable).
Before PHP 5.4.20/5.5.4 instead of FALSE you will receive -99999 upon accessing the property.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.4.20 / 5.5.4 en lugar de FALSE , recibirá -99999 al acceder a la propiedad.

Before PHP 5.4.42 and 5.5.27, repectively, additional_headers did not have mail header injection protection. Therefore, users must make sure specified headers are safe and contains headers only. i.e. Never start mail body by putting multiple newlines.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.4.42 y 5.5.27, respectivamente, additional_headers no tenía protección de inyección de encabezado de correo. Por lo tanto, los usuarios deben asegurarse de que los encabezados especificados sean seguros y solo contengan encabezados. es decir, nunca inicie el cuerpo del correo poniendo varias líneas nuevas.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.6 neither functions nor constants can be imported via the use statement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.6, no se pueden importar funciones ni constantes a través de la declaración de uso .

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 5.6 the only elements that are affected by use statements are namespaces and class names. In order to shorten a long constant or function, import its containing namespace.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 5.6, los únicos elementos afectados por las declaraciones de uso son los espacios de nombres y los nombres de clases. Para acortar una función o constante larga, importe el espacio de nombres que la contiene.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 7, Exception did not implement the Throwable interface.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 7, Exception no implementaba la interfaz Throwable .

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 7.0.0, ftp_ssl_connect() was only available if both the ftp module and the OpenSSL support have been built statically into php; this means that on Windows this function had been undefined in the official PHP builds. To have this function available on Windows, it had been necessary to compile own PHP binaries.
Before PHP 7.1.0, list() only worked on numerical arrays and assumes the numerical indices start at 0.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 7.1.0, list () solo funcionaba en matrices numéricas y asume que los índices numéricos comienzan en 0.

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 7.1.0, rewrite vars set by output_add_rewrite_var() use the same Session module trans sid output buffer. Since PHP 7.1.0, dedicated output buffer is used and output_reset_rewrite_vars() only removes rewrite vars defined by output_add_rewrite_var().
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 7.1.0, reescribir las variables establecidas por output_add_rewrite_var () usan el mismo búfer de salida trans sid del módulo Session. Desde PHP 7.1.0, se usa un búfer de salida dedicado y output_reset_rewrite_vars () solo elimina las variables de reescritura definidas por output_add_rewrite_var () .

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 7.1.0, rewrite vars set by output_add_rewrite_var() use the same Session module trans sid output buffer. Since PHP 7.1.0, dedicated output buffer is used, url_rewriter.tags is used solely for output functions, url_rewriter.hosts is added.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 7.1.0, reescribir las variables establecidas por output_add_rewrite_var () usan el mismo búfer de salida trans sid del módulo Session. Desde PHP 7.1.0, se usa un búfer de salida dedicado, url_rewriter.tags se usa únicamente para funciones de salida, se agrega url_rewriter.hosts .

trans-unit.source: Before PHP 7.2.14 and 7.3.0, respectively, SQLite3Stmt::reset() must be called after the first call to SQLite3Stmt::execute() if the bound value should be properly updated on following calls to SQLite3Stmt::execute(). If SQLite3Stmt::reset() is not called, the bound value will not change, even if the value assigned to the variable passed to SQLite3Stmt::bindParam() has changed, or SQLite3Stmt::bindParam() has been called again.
Before PHP 7.2.14 and 7.3.0, respectively, once the statement has been executed, SQLite3Stmt::reset() needs to be called to be able to change the value of bound parameters.
Before PHP 7.3, any strings that are not set will silently be skipped.
trans-unit.target: Antes de PHP 7.3,cualquier cadena que no esté puesta se saltará silenciosamente.

Before this version values of some magic constants were always lowercased. All of them are case-sensitive now (contain names as they were declared).

trans-unit.source: Before v3.0 a second argument &cas_tokens was in use. It was filled with the CAS token values for the found items. The &cas_tokens parameter was removed in v3.0 of the extension. It was replaced with a new flag Memcached::GET_EXTENDED that needs is to be used as the value for flags.
trans-unit.target: Antes de la v3.0 se &cas_tokens un segundo argumento & cas_tokens . Se llenó con los valores del token CAS para los elementos encontrados. El parámetro &cas_tokens se eliminó en la versión 3.0 de la extensión. Fue reemplazado por un nuevo indicador Memcached::GET_EXTENDED que debe usarse como valor para los flags .

trans-unit.source: Begin checking for events and calling callbacks for the default loop . Returns when a callback calls Ev::stop() method, or the flags are nonzero(in which case the return value is true) or when there are no active watchers which reference the loop( EvWatcher::keepalive() is TRUE), in which case the return value will be FALSE. The return value can generally be interpreted as if TRUE, there is more work left to do .
trans-unit.target: Comience a buscar eventos y a llamar a devoluciones de llamada para el bucle predeterminado . Devuelve cuando una devolución de llamada llama al método Ev :: stop () , o los indicadores son distintos de cero (en cuyo caso el valor de retorno es verdadero) o cuando no hay observadores activos que hagan referencia al bucle ( EvWatcher :: keepalive () es TRUE ), en cuyo caso el valor devuelto será FALSE . El valor de retorno en general, se puede interpretar como si TRUE , hay más trabajo por hacer .

El valor de retorno en general, se puede interpretar como si TRUE , hay más trabajo por hacer .

trans-unit.source: Behaves as EventBuffer::read() , except that it does not copy the data: it just removes it from the front of the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Se comporta como EventBuffer :: read () , excepto que no copia los datos: simplemente los elimina del frente del búfer.

trans-unit.source: Behaves just like EventBuffer::read() , but does not drain any data from the buffer. I.e. it copies the first max_bytes bytes from the front of the buffer into data . If there are fewer than max_bytes bytes available, the function copies all the bytes there are.
trans-unit.target: Se comporta como EventBuffer :: read () , pero no drena ningún dato del búfer. Es decir, copia los primeros bytes max_bytes del frente del búfer en data . Si hay menos de max_bytes bytes disponibles, la función copia todos los bytes que hay.

trans-unit.source: Behaves the same as strftime() except that the time returned is Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). For example, when run in Eastern Standard Time (GMT -0500), the first line below prints "Dec 31 1998 20:00:00", while the second prints "Jan 01 1999 01:00:00".
trans-unit.target: Se comporta igual que strftime () excepto que la hora devuelta es la hora media de Greenwich (GMT). Por ejemplo, cuando se ejecuta en la hora estándar del este (GMT -0500), la primera línea a continuación imprime "31 de diciembre de 1998 20:00:00", mientras que la segunda muestra "01 de enero de 1999 01:00:00".

trans-unit.source: Binds a PHP variable to a corresponding named or question mark placeholder in the SQL statement that was used to prepare the statement. Unlike PDOStatement::bindValue(), the variable is bound as a reference and will only be evaluated at the time that PDOStatement::execute() is called.
trans-unit.target: Vincula una variable PHP a un marcador de posición con nombre o signo de interrogación correspondiente en la instrucción SQL que se utilizó para preparar la declaración. A diferencia de PDOStatement :: bindValue () , la variable está vinculada como referencia y solo se evaluará en el momento en que se llame a PDOStatement :: execute () .

trans-unit.source: Bit shifting in PHP is arithmetic. Bits shifted off either end are discarded. Left shifts have zeros shifted in on the right while the sign bit is shifted out on the left, meaning the sign of an operand is not preserved. Right shifts have copies of the sign bit shifted in on the left, meaning the sign of an operand is preserved.
trans-unit.target: El cambio de bits en PHP es aritmético.Los bits que se desplazan de un extremo a otro se descartan.Los desplazamientos a la izquierda tienen ceros a la derecha mientras que el bit del signo se desplaza a la izquierda,lo que significa que el signo de un operando no se conserva.Los turnos de la derecha tienen copias del bit del signo en la izquierda,lo que significa que el signo de un operando se conserva.

trans-unit.source: Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is group executable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.

Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is group writable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is owner executable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is owner readable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is owner writable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is world executable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is world readable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a UNIX entry that is world writable. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a compressed attribute (NTFS only). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a device attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.

Bit that represents a Windows entry with a directory attribute (entry is a directory). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows. See also RarEntry::isDirectory(), which also works with entries that were not added in WinRAR.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a hidden attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.

Bit that represents a Windows entry with a normal file attribute (entry is NOT a directory). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows. See also RarEntry::isDirectory(), which also works with entries that were not added in WinRAR.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a not content indexed attribute (entry is to be indexed). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a read-only attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.

Bit that represents a Windows entry with a reparse point attribute (entry is an NTFS reparse point, e.g. a directory junction or a mount file system). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a sparse file attribute (file is an NTFS sparse file). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a system attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a temporary attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with a virtual attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with an archive attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with an encrypted attribute (NTFS only). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents a Windows entry with an offline attribute (entry is offline and not accessible). To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is Microsoft Windows.
Bit that represents the UNIX setgid attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents the UNIX setuid attribute. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.
Bit that represents the UNIX sticky bit. To be used with RarEntry::getAttr() on entries whose host OS is UNIX.

trans-unit.source: Bitmask of PHP_OUTPUT_HANDLER_* constants.

Bitmask of CURLPROTO_* values. If used, this bitmask limits what protocols libcurl may use in a transfer that it follows to in a redirect when CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION is enabled. This allows you to limit specific transfers to only be allowed to use a subset of protocols in redirections. By default libcurl will allow all protocols except for FILE and SCP. This is a difference compared to pre-7.19.4 versions which unconditionally would follow to all protocols supported. See also CURLOPT_PROTOCOLS for protocol constant values.
trans-unit.target: Máscara de CURLPROTO_* valores CURLPROTO_ * . Si se usa, esta máscara de bits limita los protocolos que libcurl puede usar en una transferencia que sigue en una redirección cuando CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION está habilitado. Esto le permite limitar transferencias específicas para que solo se le permita usar un subconjunto de protocolos en las redirecciones. Por defecto, libcurl permitirá todos los protocolos excepto FILE y SCP. Esta es una diferencia en comparación con las versiones anteriores a la 7.19.4 que seguirían incondicionalmente a todos los protocolos compatibles. Consulte también CURLOPT_PROTOCOLS para conocer los valores de las constantes de protocolo.

trans-unit.source: Bitmask of CURLPROTO_* values. If used, this bitmask limits what protocols libcurl may use in the transfer. This allows you to have a libcurl built to support a wide range of protocols but still limit specific transfers to only be allowed to use a subset of them. By default libcurl will accept all protocols it supports. See also CURLOPT_REDIR_PROTOCOLS.
trans-unit.target: Máscara de CURLPROTO_* valores CURLPROTO_ * . Si se usa, esta máscara de bits limita los protocolos que libcurl puede usar en la transferencia. Esto le permite tener un libcurl construido para admitir una amplia gama de protocolos, pero aún así limitar las transferencias específicas para que solo se le permita usar un subconjunto de ellos. Por defecto, libcurl aceptará todos los protocolos que admita. Consulte también CURLOPT_REDIR_PROTOCOLS .

By contrast to strtolower(), 'alphabetic' is determined by the Unicode character properties. Thus the behaviour of this function is not affected by locale settings and it can convert any characters that have 'alphabetic' property, such as A-umlaut (Ä).
trans-unit.target: A diferencia de strtolower () , 'alfabético' está determinado por las propiedades de los caracteres Unicode. Por lo tanto, el comportamiento de esta función no se ve afectado por la configuración regional y puede convertir cualquier carácter que tenga la propiedad 'alfabética', como A-umlaut (Ä).

trans-unit.source: By contrast to strtoupper(), 'alphabetic' is determined by the Unicode character properties. Thus the behaviour of this function is not affected by locale settings and it can convert any characters that have 'alphabetic' property, such as a-umlaut (ä).
trans-unit.target: A diferencia de strtoupper () , 'alfabético' está determinado por las propiedades de los caracteres Unicode. Por lo tanto, el comportamiento de esta función no se ve afectado por la configuración regional y puede convertir cualquier carácter que tenga la propiedad 'alfabética', como a-umlaut (ä).

trans-unit.source: By contrast to the standard case folding functions such as strtolower() and strtoupper(), case folding is performed on the basis of the Unicode character properties. Thus the behaviour of this function is not affected by locale settings and it can convert any characters that have 'alphabetic' property, such as A-umlaut (Ä).
trans-unit.target: A diferencia de las funciones estándar de plegado de mayúsculas y minúsculas, como strtolower () y strtoupper () , el plegado de mayúsculas y minúsculas se realiza sobre la base de las propiedades de los caracteres Unicode. Por lo tanto, el comportamiento de esta función no se ve afectado por la configuración regional y puede convertir cualquier carácter que tenga la propiedad 'alfabética', como A-umlaut (Ä).

trans-unit.source: By default pg_delete() passes raw values. Values must be escaped or PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE option must be specified. PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE quotes and escapes parameters/identifiers. Therefore, table/column names became case sensitive.

By default pg_insert() passes raw values. Values must be escaped or PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE option must be specified. PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE quotes and escapes parameters/identifiers. Therefore, table/column names became case sensitive.

By default pg_select() passes raw values. Values must be escaped or PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE option must be specified. PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE quotes and escapes parameters/identifiers. Therefore, table/column names became case sensitive.

By default pg_update() passes raw values. Values must be escaped or PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE option must be specified. PGSQL_DML_ESCAPE quotes and escapes parameters/identifiers. Therefore, table/column names became case sensitive.
By default Libevent turns underlying file descriptors, or sockets, to non-blocking mode. This flag tells Libevent to leave them in blocking mode.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,Libevent convierte los descriptores de archivos subyacentes,o sockets,en modo no bloqueante.Esta bandera le dice a Libevent que los deje en modo de bloqueo.

trans-unit.source: By default all events are scheduled with the same priority (npriorities/2). Using event_base_priority_init() you can change the number of event priority levels and then set a desired priority for each event.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, todos los eventos se programan con la misma prioridad ( npriorities / 2). Usando event_base_priority_init () puede cambiar el número de niveles de prioridad de eventos y luego establecer una prioridad deseada para cada evento.
